item.title: Data Hiding in ES6
item.description:
One of the first things that really bugged me about JavaScript as I slowly started to pick up the language, was its poor and cumbersome support for data hiding. Much of my background was with object oriented development. I believed strongly in encapsulation, object heirarchies, and static typing. But I have changed, of course, and so much of the dogma and ceremony that I participated in during those years has come to seem a lot less important than they did 20 years ago. But that doesn't mean there aren't some really good lessons to learn from those languages and styles. Take, for instance, data encapsulation.
